section.name: PortletBridge
section.p: The Portlet Bridge project is intended to allow regular web sites be hosted as portlets. See the PortletBridge Portlet project for more information.

In addition to creating a bridging portlet, this project will also include support for proxying HTML without a portal container. There is a demo of portletbridge acting as a HTML proxy here which demonstrates the portletbridge in action. Please note, however:
It's very slow because the demo is on a very slow link
It doesn't rewrite javascript
The code is changed on its way through the HTMLSAXParser and link rewriter which does result in unwanted artifacts
See the portletbridge-web project for configuration settings.

section.name: Requirements
section.p: Portlet Bridge requires Java 1.4 or above.

section.name: Credits
